column3: Is Debian the only distro supporting this standard?

freedesktop standards in principle apply to all distributions and window managers.\nSo it would make sense to move it from `contrib/debian` to a place where `make install` can install it (not in thie PR though).

I don 't think `Qt` is a useful category. It's like adding `C++`. Not relevant to classifying the application.\nAgree with adding `P2P` or `Network` though I'd say one of them is enough (but adding both is fine with me...).
The `Qt` category is defined as "Application based on Qt libraries", which certainly applies to bitcoin-qt.\n\nhttps://specifications.freedesktop.org/menu-spec/latest/apas02.html
Huh, okay.\nWell if it's part of the standard then ok...
